definition: to exceed/to overtake/to surpass/to transcend/to pass/to cross/ultra-/super-
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159
to overtake on a bend (driving)/(fig.) taking opportunity of tight corners to make swift progress (economy etc)

sentences.english: As for the lack of overtaking, the Ferrari man had no miracle solution.
sentences.chinese: 至於缺乏超車，這位法拉利車手沒有什麼好的辦法。

sentences.english: A:But he's equally responsible because he tried to overtake you.
sentences.chinese: 但是他同樣該承擔責任，因爲他試圖超車。

sentences.english: It appears a short moment after he overtakes the Volvo: the omen.
sentences.chinese: 佛教徒超車過了沃爾沃沒多久，預兆出現了。

sentences.english: The system also observes overtaking rules and speed limits.
sentences.chinese: 系統還能觀察超車換道規則和最高限速。

sentences.english: Our huge college bus careens around small cars as it heads to the monumental site.
sentences.chinese: 我們所乘坐的大型巴士在小車羣中左右變線超車。

sentences.english: When passing another car on two-lane roads, pass on the left.
sentences.chinese: 在兩股道的公路上超車，必須從左車道超車。

sentences.english: When passing another car on two-lane roads, pass on the left.
sentences.chinese: 在兩股道的公路上超車，必須從左車道超車。

sentences.english: When the other car passes you, you speed up and overtake on the right again.
sentences.chinese: 當這輛車超過你，你提速再從右側超車。

sentences.english: I was carved up by a lunatic in a Porsche.
sentences.chinese: 一個開保時捷的瘋子超車搶了我的道。

sentences.english: It is a good track with a very long straight and nice overtaking opportunities.
sentences.chinese: 這個賽道有很長的直道和很好的超車機會。

sentences.english: The road be too narrow to overtake .
sentences.chinese: 這條路太窄了，不能超車。

sentences.english: Tell us about that overtaking manoeuvre with Jenson.
sentences.chinese: 跟我們講講有關簡森的超車策略。

sentences.english: We got behind a truck that purposely hogged the road so that we couldn't pass.
sentences.chinese: 我們碰上一輛故意堵着路不讓我們超車的卡車。

sentences.english: Overtaking is not just about power, though.
sentences.chinese: 儘管如此，超車不僅僅在於動力。

definition: to avoid/to yield (in traffic)/to get out of the way
to dress (troops)/to line up (to arrange in a straight line)
lit. bashing sideways and colliding straight on (idiom); to push through shoving and bumping/to barge/to charge around violently
